required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Adjuvant Melanoma Stakeholder Treatment Preferences
clinical_study.official_title: Adjuvant Melanoma Stakeholder Treatment Preference Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to understand the trade-offs that participants with surgically treated melanoma would be willing to make among key features and outcomes of adjuvant anti-cancer treatments or no adjuvant treatment / observation.

primary_outcome.measure: Preference weights or utilities (a measure of relative preference; on a continuous variable scale) for each treatment attribute level based on responses to the Discrete Choice Experiment (DCE) choice tasks

arm_group.description: Participants diagnosed with stage II and stage III melanoma who have undergone surgery

study_pop.textblock: This study is to include 350 adult participants from the US, Australia, UK, Germany, France, Spain, and Italy who self-report to have stage IIb, IIc, or III melanoma and who have had surgery for melanoma within 12 months.

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding Bristol-Myers Squibb Clinical Trial participation, please visit www.BMSStudyConnect.com
Inclusion Criteria:
- Self-reported medical diagnosis of stage II or stage III melanoma
- Have been resected (had surgery) for their melanoma within 12 months prior to study participation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Self-reported stage IIa
- Self-reported recurrence of melanoma after surgery
Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria apply

overall_contact.last_name: Recruiting sites have contact information. Please contact the sites directly. If there is no contact information,

overall_contact_backup.last_name: First line of the email MUST contain NCT # and Site #.
